titleStmt.title: A knot untied or, allegiance sworn to the King, no breach of allegiance due unto God : written at the request, and for the private satisfaction of some friends: but now made publick for the benefit of all such, who (in tenderness of conscience towards God) scruple the taking of the said oath.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Henry Eversden at the Greyhound in Saint Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
